race.name: Nagaran
entries: Your nagaran character shares a number of serpentine characteristics with all other nagaran.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Dexterity or Constitution score increases by 1 (your choice).

entries.name: Age
entries: Nagaran have an exceptionally long lifespan, blessed by the immortal nature of their naga ancestors. Nagaran reach adulthood around 12 years of age and can live for over 500 years.

entries.name: Common Alignment
entries: Nagaran span the entire spectrum of alignments, with slight predispositions based on their ancestry: {@race Nagaran (Guardian)|CaChRn|guardian nagaran} tend toward law and good, those of {@race Nagaran (Water)|CaChRn|water naga} descent have a neutral bent, and {@race Nagaran (Spirit)|CaChRn|spirit nagaran} are inclined toward evil and chaos.

entries.name: Size
entries: Nagaran can stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and have a tail that stretches another 5 to 10 feet when fully uncoiled. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Speed
entries: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

entries.name: Ophidian Strikes
entries: Your venomous bite and constricting tail are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. On a hit, your bite deals piercing damage equal to 1 + your Strength modifier plus an extra {@damage 1d4} poison damage, and your tail deals bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d6} + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

In addition, whenever you attempt to {@action grapple} a creature, you can choose to do so with your tail, leaving your hands free to use as normal. While grappling a creature with your tail, your walking speed is reduced to 0.

entries.name: Poison Resilience
entries: You have resistance to poison damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned}.

entries.name: Rejuvenatory Spirit
entries: If a spell, such as {@spell raise dead}, has the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on you. Once you benefit from this trait, you can't do so again until 7 days have passed.

entries.name: Shed Skin
entries: While you are {@condition grappled}, {@condition restrained}, or otherwise physically bound (such as by {@item manacles|PHB}), you can use your action to automatically escape. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Suggested Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Common} and {@language Serpentine|CaChRn}.

entries.name: Subrace
entries: There are three kinds of nagaran: {@race Nagaran (Guardian)|CaChRn|guardian}, {@race Nagaran (Spirit)|CaChRn|spirit}, and {@race Nagaran (Water)|CaChRn|water}. Choose one of these subraces.

subrace.name: Guardian
entries: Whether it be their friends, family, home, or possessions, guardian nagaran are protective to a fault and will stop at nothing to secure and defend that which they value most.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Wisdom score increases by 2.

entries.name: Guardian's Inheritance
entries: You know the {@spell mending} cantrip and can cast it with no material components. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell cure wounds} once with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell calm emotions} once with this trait. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your suggested spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Suggested Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Celestial|CaChRn}.

subrace.name: Spirit
entries: Spirit nagaran are notoriously tenacious. If left to their own devices, they prefer to outsmart their foes and defeat them with exceptional strategy rather than combat.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2.

entries.name: Spirit's Inheritance
entries: You know the {@spell minor illusion} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell charm person} once with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell detect thoughts} once with this trait. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Intelligence is your suggested spellcasting ability for these spells, and they require no material components when you cast them using this trait.

entries.name: Suggested Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Abyssal|CaChRn}.

subrace.name: Water
entries: The pragmatic water nagaran pride themselves on sustaining a life of self-sufficiency, unclouded by bias. They rarely seek to maintain long term, intimate relationships.

entries.name: Suggested Ability Score Increase
entries: Your Charisma score increases by 2.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, and you can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Water's Inheritance
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast {@spell expeditious retreat} once with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast {@spell invisibility} once with this trait, requiring no material components. You regain the ability to cast these spells with this trait when you finish a long rest. Charisma is your suggested spellcasting ability for these spells.

entries.name: Suggested Extra Language
entries: You can speak, read, and write {@language Primordial|CaChRn|Aquan}.

raceFluff.name: Nagaran
entries: {@font Nagaran|serpentine}

Nagaran are an intelligent serpentine race originally created by nagas and infused with their essence as a show of nagan superiority over other reptilian races and their respective kin. All nagaran possess a long, snakelike body and a flared hood: an expanded neck, which they can exaggerate further in a menacing display of power.

entries.name: Ancestors' Legacy
entries: Nagaran embrace many qualities from their creators, but they eschew some others. They are naturally proficient with magic, much more so than other serpentfolk, and they possess a sliver of their forebears' immortality, but they are overall much more amicable in their dealings with other races—a courtesy that is often not returned.

entries.name: Vain Origins
entries: Nagas are known to be overconfident and distrusting of other beings, leading them to rule their domains with absolute authority. Their ubiquitous vainglory inspired them to create a subordinate race of creatures to populate and defend their lairs: one nevertheless superior to other humanoids in their eyes.

The immortal nagas patiently groomed various species of cobras over the course of hundreds of years, slowly infusing them with their magic as time passed. When they were satisfied with the monstrous, magical serpents they had created, the nagas performed an ancient ritual (some say of their own design, some say passed down by another long-forgotten race), infusing the snakes with a precise concoction of their blood and venom.

The newly awakened snakes hissed, and spoke, and obediently served the nagas for decades, but it wasn't long before some ventured forth from their overbearing masters' lairs. The guardian nagaran were the first to depart—their creators being the most benevolent—but shortly thereafter, the water nagaran's longing for independence and the spirit nagaran's desire to escape their brutal tyrants also drove them to new lands to establish a life of their own.

entries.name: Nagaran Names
entries: Nagaran employ a unique naming system wherein the tongue of their naga ancestors is intermixed with the natural hisses and sounds from their cobra roots.

items.name: Female Names:
items.entry: Altha, Diron, Esteca, Kilha, Leta, Milasi, Miya, Rautant, Roga, Tiyanga, Venine, Vipra, Ylan

items.name: Male Names:
items.entry: Bathan, Daron, Gnish, Kig, Kulez, Limek, Nakh, Noko, Rafsa, Sig, Skaln, Tuntun, Zalo

language.name: Serpentine
entries: {@font SERPENTINE|serpentine}

Though Serpentine's origins are markedly more recent than those of {@language Draconic|CaChRn} itself, it is believed that the dialect was formalized by prominent serpentine creatures— such as elder behirs and dracolisks—in direct revolt of the great wyrms who lorded their magic, wealth, and power over their kin. Similar to {@language Draconic|CaChRn}, this dialects disenchanted creators invented it to communicate away from the prying ears of their tyrannical overlords.

Though Serpentine shares much in common with its predecessor, its script is deliberately challenging for draconic creatures to write, and its speakers similarly prefer words that are challenging for dragons to pronounce.

entries.name: Viperous Convictions
entries: In defiance of {@language Draconic|CaChRn} norms, Serpentine runes are able to be quickly activated by all who wield them. Instead, the requisite time to enact the rune's magic manifests as a delayed release, either over time or all at once.

entries.name: Serpentine Runes
entries: The following runes are presented in alphabetical order. As with other magic items, a rune's description gives its name, its category (including which language it belongs to), its rarity, and its magical properties; it also indicates what type of object(s) the rune can be transferred to.

entries.name: Special Features
entries: Similar to its predecessor ({@language Draconic|CaChRn}), Serpentine numbers are visibly distinguished from letters by a small curved mark below the symbol.

The behir is a serpentine monster that can slither like a snake or use its dozen legs to move with considerable speed. A behir is about 40 feet long and weighs about 4,000 pounds. The coloration of behirs ranges from ultramarine to deep blue with bands of gray-brown.

{@font The behir is a serpentine monster that can slither like a snake or use its dozen legs to move with considerable speed. A behir is about 40 feet long and weighs about 4,000 pounds. The coloration of behirs ranges from ultramarine to deep blue with bands of gray-brown.|serpentine}
My in-laws said, "Mr. Smith's 7 cats & dogs are the best ever!"
{@font My in-laws said, "Mr. Smith's 7 cats & dogs are the best ever!"|serpentine}
{@font 43 + 981 = 1,024|serpentine}

action.name: Reposition
entries: While {@action grapple||grappling} a creature, you can make a special melee attack to attempt to pull it to another nearby space. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this attack replaces one of them.

You make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (the target chooses the ability to use). If you win the contest, you can move the target to another unoccupied space of your choice that is within your reach.

action.name: Throw
entries: While {@action grapple||grappling} a creature, you can make a special melee attack to attempt to throw it. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the {@action Attack} action, this attack replaces one of them.

You make a Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check (the target chooses the ability to use). If the target is your size or larger, you make this check with disadvantage.

If you win the contest, you can throw the target horizontally a number of feet up to 5 × your Strength modifier (minimum of 5 feet), or half as far if you throw the target vertically. If the target fails the contest by 5 or more, it falls {@condition prone} at the end of the throw. Whether you win or lose the contest, your {@action grapple} ends on the target after attempting to throw it.

data.name: Placeholder
entries: {@note At this time this source has been only partially converted. The available material is listed below:}

items: {@race Nagaran|CaChRn} and subraces thereof
{@class Barbarian|PHB|Path of Shamanic Wrath|Shamanic Wrath|CaChRn}
{@class Rogue|PHB|Enforcer|Enforcer|CaChRn}
{@action Reposition|CaChRn}
{@action Throw|CaChRn}
{@language Serpentine|CaChRn} and runes thereof
